definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
variant of 收穫|收获[shou1 huo4]

sentences.english: My grandpa told me there was people coming for it each year.
sentences.chinese: 外公說，每年這裏都會有收藥材的人上山。

sentences.english: I get about 100 e-mails a day.
The doctor answerable me a fee.
Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 債主從公司收舊賬或者跟債務人討小錢。

sentences.english: Are you sure you want to close the selected payee?
sentences.chinese: 你確認要關閉選定的收付款人？

sentences.english: Receive fax-in and sort by dept. Distribute fax once a day.
sentences.chinese: 收傳真並分類，每天一次按部門分發傳真。

sentences.english: Price of waste collection job processing.
sentences.chinese: 價格比收廢品的高就處理了。

sentences.english: Receiving one-fifth, and sixth in conjunction with cabin to stay together by the end.
sentences.chinese: 第五聯收貨單及第六聯由配艙人留底。

sentences.english: On Revenue avenue, the grave traveler jumped the gravestone bravely .
sentences.chinese: 在稿收大道上，嚴肅的旅行者勇敢地跳過墓碑。

sentences.english: Step 4 Collect yourself, or ask a student to collect, the slips of paper.
sentences.chinese: 老師自己收，或者請一名學生把紙條收上來。

sentences.english: The components and auxiliary materials, etc, supplied by party bare to be shipped from Japan to Henna.
sentences.chinese: 收乙方提供的元件和輔助材料等將從日本裝運至河南。

sentences.english: Hakuo then accepted her as a disciple.
The croupier wished him luck and spun the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 收賭注的人祝他好運，然後將輪盤轉動起來。

sentences.english: It asks you "save file bla-bla-bla" only after it recieves the file.
sentences.chinese: 收文件後，詢問你“是否保存文件”。

sentences.english: The farm s fruit crop amounted to about 700000 kg. this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年這個農場的水果收了約七十萬千克。

sentences.english: Everyone accepted the bribe except him.
sentences.chinese: 除了他，每一個人都收紅包。

definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to check sth and accept it
to regain/to retake/to take back/to withdraw/to revoke
to hand over to/to give to higher authority/to seek connections in high places
to transfer (income, profits etc) to higher authorities
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
